snippet: Mary Jo White, nominated to head the S.E.C., has a long résumé as a prosecutor, though it includes few cases against large financial institutions.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column observes that Mary Jo White, nominee to head Securities and Exchange Commission, has a long resume as prosecutor, though it includes few cases against large financial institutions; posits that her mixed record on financial fraud cases, coupled with her more recent defense work on behalf of large banks, means she still has much to prove to investors that the SEC protects.
lead_paragraph: Mary Jo White, nominated to head the S.E.C., has a long résumé as a prosecutor, though it includes few cases against large financial institutions.

headline.seo: For Mary Jo White, Few Big-Bank Cases as a Prosecutor
headline.main: Corralling Mobsters, if Not Many Big Banks
headline.print_headline: Corralling Mobsters, if Not Many Big Banks
